30 30

Celebrating 30 Years of AIDS Vancouver

The 30 30 campaign was created in 2013 to celebrate AIDS Vancouver’s 30th anniversary. The campaign pieces together the dynamic history of HIV in Vancouver, told by and for those who where there.

Before 1983

AIDS: The Beginning

  • Blood plasma taken from a patient in Congo in 1959, proven to be HIV positive in 1989, is the first known AIDS case. LINK
  • 1960’s: West African HIV-2 is thought to have transferred to people from sooty mangabey monkeys in Guinea-Bissau. LINK
  • 1976: The first documented case of AIDS in Europe was seen in a Danish surgeon who had worked in Zaire. She died in 1976. LINK
  • 1976: HIV found in tissue samples from a Norwegian sailor who died around 1976. LINK
  • June 1979 – Nov 1981: 12 strange KS cases in Haiti LINK
  • 1982: United States reports 771 cases of AIDS and 618 deaths. LINK
  • 1979 – 1982: The Public Health Agency of Canada reports 38 AIDS Cases. LINK
  • The Centers for Disease Control in Atlanta, US (CDC) published a Morbidity and Mortality Weekly Report (MMWR), which detailed a rare lung infection among otherwise healthy gay men in Los Angeles. This 1981 edition now marks the first official reporting on what is now known as AIDS. LINK
  • 1981: Gay Men's Health Crisis (GMHC), the first known AIDS organization was created. LINK
  • The first baby, who received multiple blood transfusions, died from infections similar to other AIDS cases. Reference: MMWR Weekly (1982) 'Unexplained Immunodeficiency and Opportunistic Infections in Infants- New York, New Jersey, California', December 17,31 (49); 665-667.
  • 1981: Gay-Related Immune Deficiency (GRID) , or 'gay cancer' by the media becomes the terms used for AIDS. LINK
  • In Canada AIDS was reported in 1979 in Montreal, which later became known as Canada’s first AIDS case. LINK
  • 1982 in Vancouver, newspaper article 'City gay suffering disease', reads 'Health officials have confirmed that a Vancouver homosexual is undergoing treatment for a potentially fatal disease that has been found in increasingly high numbers among homosexual males in the U.S.' Vancouver Sun July 28, 1982.
1983

AIDS Vancouver - Prevent. Act. Support.
Celebrating 30 Years of AIDS Vancouver
  • 30th Anniversary RSVP
  • Donate
  • Acknowledgements

AIDS Vancouver plays a special role in providing quality health care to people affected by HIV/AIDS living in the Lower Mainland. It is clearly more than just a community health care organization. It is an organization whose presence and continued strength is essential to the quality for life of this community and of each individual and family who draws on its services.

Our Agency is a vital community asset which everyone affected by HIV/AIDS can share, and in which we all have a stake.

Visit us at aidsvancouver.org

2013 © AIDS Vancouver
